skill.name: requesting-code-review
skill.description: Use when you need to request a code review for a PR/MR and want a consistent review brief (context, scope, risk areas, test instructions, acceptance criteria) before merge.

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and prompt templates with no executable code. All 40 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES triggered by the scanner misinterpreting documentation patterns. Git SHA references, bash code examples, and metadata fields are not security risks. The skill-report.json already correctly assessed this as 'safe' with no risk factors.

content.value_statement: Code reviews catch bugs and quality issues before they reach production. This skill provides structured prompts and checklists for AI-powered code review of pull requests and merge requests.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes code changes between git commits
Reviews test coverage and edge cases
Provides structured review with severity levels
limitations: Does not execute or modify code

use_cases.title: Pre-merge Reviews
use_cases.description: Review changes before merging to catch issues early

use_cases.title: Quality Gates
use_cases.description: Enforce code quality standards across the team

use_cases.title: Contribution Reviews
use_cases.description: Review pull requests consistently and fairly

prompt_templates.title: Basic Review Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this feature implementation. What was implemented: {WHAT_WAS_IMPLEMENTED}. Requirements: {PLAN_OR_REQUIREMENTS}. Git range: {BASE_SHA}..{HEAD_SHA}

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the architecture of these changes. Focus on scalability, performance, and design decisions. Base: {BASE_SHA}, Head: {HEAD_SHA}

prompt_templates.title: Security Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a security review of these changes. Check for vulnerabilities, input validation, and data handling. {DESCRIPTION}

prompt_templates.title: Full Code Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Complete code review against {PLAN_OR_REQUIREMENTS}. Check: code quality, architecture, testing, requirements, production readiness. Base: {BASE_SHA}, Head: {HEAD_SHA}. Provide strengths, issues by severity, and readiness assessment.

output_examples.input: Review my authentication module implementation. Base SHA: a7981ec, Head SHA: 3df7661. Requirements are in auth-spec.md.
output: Strengths: Clean separation of concerns, good error handling
Issues: Important - Missing rate limiting, Critical - SQL injection vulnerability in login query
Minor: Inconsistent error messages across endpoints
Assessment: Not ready - fix critical issue before merge

output_examples.input: Review database schema changes. Base: 4a2b1c, Head: 9f8e7d. Plan is in migration-plan.md.
output: Strengths: Proper foreign key constraints, good index strategy
Issues: Important - No rollback migration defined
Minor: Table name could be more descriptive
Assessment: Ready with fixes - add rollback before merge

best_practices: Review after each task to catch issues before they compound
Fix Critical and Important issues before proceeding
Use specific file:line references in feedback
anti_patterns: Skipping review because changes seem simple
Ignoring Critical issues to meet deadlines
Being vague in feedback without specific locations

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works with any AI that can process markdown templates.

faq.question: What git commands are required?
faq.answer: You need git to identify commit ranges. The skill uses git diff and git log to understand changes.

faq.question: How detailed is the review output?
faq.answer: Reviews include strengths, issues by severity (Critical/Important/Minor), specific file:line references, and a merge readiness assessment.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill. Code is processed by your AI tool locally. No code is sent to external services.

faq.question: What if the review finds no issues?
faq.answer: The template requires acknowledging strengths and giving a clear verdict. Reviewers should never say looks good without checking.

faq.question: How is this different from linters?
faq.answer: Linters check syntax and style. This skill provides architectural feedback, validates requirements, and assesses production readiness.
